intro: Duranta repens var. canescens, commonly known as silverleaf duranta, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a trailing or shrubby perennial that produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine, silvery-white down, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is often used in ornamental landscaping. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to adapt to various soil types.
